Author: Alright#0419
Content: can someone explain to me when `invalidateblock` would ever actually be useful?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I understand what it does, but I don't understand the situation where it would be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when your node goes on a fork and you dont want to be on that fork, invalidate the first block of the fork

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: can that be used as a way to "delete blocks" to try and get back onto main chain?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it sounds like a way that you can manually try to go onto a known good chain, before waiting 100 blocks until reorganization rule kicks in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given a known fork, just invalidate its first block and nodes wont follow it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @dukeleto why is that 100 block reorg rule a thing?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just a hardcoded limit inherited from zcash

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or maybe they inherited from bitcoin

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Maybe do away with that?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not the warning, but the shutting node down

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it shuts down the network pretty much

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, i guess both good and bad nodes shutdown?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yea it shuts down honest nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, remove it and see what happens

Author: Alright#0419
Content: ðŸ‘Œ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I think not allowing it to reorg would be a good thing, but shutting down the node is a bad thing

Author: Alright#0419
Content: An honest 100 block reorg isn't likely. The only reason that would happen is if there is serious problems with the network

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not allowing it to reorg will cause a fork, but it's very unlikely to happen without a bad actor doing it purposefully

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@dukeleto 

To crash the chain, I just did the command:

```
curl --user user138763741:pass5ff9f6434ed6405b884fc24ee41e590a64fcf163ee9f9c44e973124935aed7a9fc     --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "invalidateblock", "params": ["02f51fb2793b0728050c5e983ffed669594e0a2dda01dcb7a68d129fd87436e0"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:9801/ | jq
```

I put a .txt file above that has a bunch of garbled gibberish that came out of the `regtest` daemon after some time. You can see it linked above.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
```
Examples
> komodo-cli createrawtransaction "[{\"txid\":\"myid\",\"vout\":0}]" "{\"address\":0.01}"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "createrawtransaction", "params": ["[{\"txid\":\"myid\",\"vout\":0}]", "{\"address\":0.01}"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:7771/
```
